title: Overall US Job Displacement by 2030
description: Projected net percentage of US jobs displaced by AI and automation by 2030, accounting for both eliminated and restructured roles.

sources.title: The Potentially Large Effects of AI on Economic Growth
sources.excerpt: Roughly two-thirds of current jobs are exposed to some degree of AI automation; generative AI could substitute up to one-fourth of current work.

sources.title: OECD Employment Outlook 2023: AI and the Labour Market
sources.excerpt: 27% of jobs are in occupations at high risk of automation across OECD countries.

sources.title: Gen-AI: Artificial Intelligence and the Future of Work
sources.excerpt: Almost 40% of global employment is exposed to AI, with advanced economies more affected.

sources.title: The Simple Macroeconomics of AI
sources.excerpt: AI may increase TFP by only 0.53-0.66% over 10 years, with limited job displacement effects.

sources.title: AI Is Starting to Threaten White-Collar Jobs
AI And Automation Will Take 6% Of US Jobs By 2030
AI exposure predicts unemployment risk
sources.excerpt: Workers in AI-exposed occupations face significantly higher unemployment risk.

sources.title: We're not ready for mass AI unemployment
Bureau of Labor Statistics Employment Projections 2024-2034
IBM 2024 10-K — AI Strategy & Workforce Transformation
sources.excerpt: IBM CEO stated plans to replace ~7,800 back-office roles with AI. Company investing in reskilling remaining workforce for AI-augmented roles.

sources.title: Total US Job Postings Trend Analysis — January 2025
sources.excerpt: Total US job postings are 15% below their February 2022 peak. Categories most exposed to AI (data entry, basic admin, customer service) show steepest declines.

sources.title: Amazon Q4 2024 8-K — AI Fulfillment & Workforce Impact
sources.excerpt: Amazon reported 75% increase in robotic and AI systems in fulfillment centers. Warehouse associate hiring slowed while 'AI specialist' roles grew 3x.

sources.title: AI and the U.S. Labor Market: No Macro Displacement Yet
sources.excerpt: Analysis finds no significant macro-level job displacement from AI as of late 2025, though structural shifts are emerging in specific sectors.

sources.title: Future of Jobs Report 2025
sources.excerpt: 40% of employers globally expect to reduce headcount as AI automates tasks. Net displacement estimates range from 5-14% of current roles by 2030.

sources.title: Sam Altman warns AI could displace significant share of jobs
New data show no AI jobs apocalypse — for now
sources.excerpt: Despite fears of imminent AI jobs apocalypse, the overall labor market shows more continuity than disruption since ChatGPT's launch.

sources.title: The Labor Market Effects of Generative Artificial Intelligence
sources.publisher: Stanford / World Bank (Hartley, Jolevski, Melo, Moore)
sources.excerpt: 35.9% of US workers used generative AI by December 2025; small positive wage effects, no significant decline in job openings.

sources.title: Steering Technological Progress
sources.excerpt: Framework for guiding innovation to increase labor demand; steering technology becomes more desirable the less efficient social safety nets are.
